topic.title: 7.1 When Alarm Is Triggered on Spindle Cooler

header.para: When Alarm Is Triggered on Spindle Cooler

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

td.para: • Broken connection of the oil temperature sensor.
• Check whether the connection of the oil temperature sensor is
• If the connection is not broken, chances are either the temperature
controller or the sensor has failed.
• Reconnect the wire connection or replace the wire if necessary.
There is a problem with the ambient or machine body temperature sensor.
• The wire connection of the ambient or machine body temperature
• The ambient or machine body temperature sensor has failed.
• Check whether or not the wire for ambient or machine body
• If there are no problems with the connection, chances are
either the sensor or the temperature controller is faulty.
• Reconnect the wire connection or replace the wire if necessary.
Oil temperature is too high for the temperature controller to process.
• Process load is over the limit of the temperature controller’s capacity.
• Check whether the ambient and oil temperature are higher than
• Check whether or not the temperature controller is capable for
• Check if the temperature sensor is functioning properly or not.
• Check if the refrigeration system is in order or not.
• Change the temperature controller to a larger cooling capacity.
• Contact the refrigerator service technician for refrigeration

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

td.para: Oil temperature is too low for the temperature controller to process.
• Process load is lower than the limit of the temperature controller’s
• Check if the ambient and oil temperature are above 5oC.
• Check if the temperature sensor is functioning properly or not.
• Check if the refrigeration system is in order or not.
• Contact the refrigerator service technician for refrigeration system
There is a pressure fault within the refrigeration system.
• Low or over charge of refrigerant.
• Obstruction or leakage occurred in the refrigeration system.
• Condenser or air filter is dirty.
• Check if the copper pipe near the low pressure side of the
• Check if the fins of the condenser are not hot.
• Check if the temperature controller’s internal temperature is too high.
• Check if the fan or motor is out of order or not.
• Clean the air filter and the condenser regularly to improve the heat
dissipation and remove any obstructions from air intake or exhaust.
• Contact the refrigerator service technician for refrigeration system
There is a fault within the oil pump which trip-out the overload protector.
• Check if the oil pump is functioning properly or not.
• Check if the oil pressure is too high to cause the overload protector
• Check if the oil pipe is clogged.
• Clean the oil circulating system, add a filter if necessary.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

td.para: Pressure fault or insufficient amount of oil within the oil circulating system.
• No oil flow or flow rate is too low.
• Set point of the oil pressure switch is not within the designed
• Failure of the oil pressure switch or flow switch.
• Air goes into the oil pipes or the diameter of the pipes are too
• Oil used is not within the viscosity range.
• Check if the oil supply is sufficient.
• Check if the pressure switch is set within the designed
• Check if the oil pressure switch or flow switch is functioning
• Check if the pipes diameter are too small.
• Check if the oil used is within the viscosity range.
• Check the pump motor is functioning properly or not.
• Supply sufficient amount of oil in the oil circulating system.
• Set the pressure switch to the designed specification.
• Replace the oil pressure switch or the flow switch.
• Increase the pipe diameter or shorten the length of the pipe to
• Use oil within the viscosity range.
Power phase input has been reversed.
• Check if the power cable is connected with correct phase
• If the power phase is correct, chances are the reverse-phase
relay or the temperature controller has failed.
• Reconnect the power cable with correct phase.
• Incorrect input power voltage or phase.
• Check if the hot air exhaust system is clogged.
• Check if the input power or phase is correct.
• Clean the air vent regularly to improve the heat dissipation
and remove any obstructions from air exhaust.
• Reconnect the power cable with correct phase.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

td.para: Oil level in tank is too low.
• Check if the oil level if sufficient.
• Check if the oil level switch is functioning properly or not.
• Replace the faulty oil level switch.
• Supply power phase not connected properly.
• Check if the supply power phase is connected properly.
• Check if the temperature controller is functioning properly or not.
• Replace the possible failed temperature controller.
• Sudden overload of the fan motor.
• Check if the fan motor is overload.
• Check if the fan motor is functioning properly or not.
• Insufficient or no cooling liquid within the system.
• No output contact of the thermal servo.
• Check if there is sufficient cooling liquid within the system or if there
• Check the output contact of the thermal servo.
• Refill the cooling liquid and examine the flow for problems.
